author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Centre has decided to amend the A.P. Reorganisation Act to increase the number of Assembly seats in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

Union Minister for Parliamentary Affairs and Urban Development M. Venkaiah Naidu, who held extensive discussions on the issue with Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh at Delhi on Tuesday, told reporters later that both the States have written to the Centre seeking implementation of Section 26 of the Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act, which provides for increasing the number of Assembly Constituencies of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana from 175 to 225 and 119 to 153 respectively.

Both the Union Ministers held discussions with Law Secretary, Legislative Secretary, Home Secretary, Joint Secretaries of Home and Parliamentary Affairs and Law Officers.

Two opinions

Mr. Naidu said two opinions were expressed about the options to give effect to Section 26 of A.P. Reorganisation Act – one was to amend the Constitution and the other was to amend the Act.

Extensive deliberations

After extensive deliberations, it was decided to amend the A.P. Reorganisation Act.

“Home Ministry will now write to the Ministry of Law, which in turn will get the opinion of Attorney General of India. The Central government is keen on amending the A.P. Reorganisation Act after getting the opinion of Attorney General of India. I am confident that the people of Telugu States will soon hear good news,” he added.

Assembly seats in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana to go up from 175 to 225 and 119 to 153 respectively
title: Centre keen on amending A.P. Reorganisation Act: Venkaiah
